entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony had a small audience due to a terrible snow storm in Decatur Ind. She had a fine audience at La Grange and had to wake up early to go to Muncie.

entries.fullText:
Stopped at Kirby Hotel
Mr & Mrs McRae--the
Principals of Schools here--
Volney Wilson lives here--he
after conquering all things is
himself overcome by his
appetite for whiskey
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony stayed at the Kirby Hotel in Muncie Ind and met with Mr & Mrs McRae, the principals of schools there. She also mentions Volney Wilson's struggle with alcohol.

entries.fullText:
Had big pile of letters here--
A Quaker settlement and
[?] --always give me
best of audiences--
Though the roads are very
muddy--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony received a big pile of letters in Pendleton--Ind. She also mentions a Quaker settlement that always gives her the best of audiences despite the muddy roads.

entries.fullText:
Left M Morris at 6 A.M.
for Indianapolis--& spent the
day with Mrs. May Wright Thompson
561 North Alabama St.--2 doors north of St. Marys
--rained all day--Mrs. E. Gen. Wallace
called--also Mrs. Dr. Swain--Mr. & Mrs.
Haggart--of 'Woman's Tribune' published
at Ind. and Mrs. Garrison--one
of the Ind. Herald Staff of Editors
--at 8 P.M. took carriage to the
Grand Hotel--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Indianapolis and spends the day with Mrs. May Wright Thompson and meets with several other people.

entries.fullText:
Liberty--Ind.--W. P. Bowers
Took train [?] Ind. at
4.18 A.M. arrived at L.
at 7.20--pouring rain still
got good letter from sister May in P.M.
This is our dear mothers
85th birth day--& my sister May
is at home--they celebrated yesterday--had
niece Maggie & little family & niece
Louise--dear Gula & Hannah darling girls
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Liberty, Indiana and receives a letter from her sister May on their mother's 85th birthday.

entries.fullText:
Thorntown Ind--
Mrs. C. M. Cornish
Liberty at 9 A.M. & arrived
at T. at 2 P.M.--Stopped
at Hills Hotel--M.E.
minister Smith introduced
me--small audience--
pouring rain--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Thorntown, Indiana and speaks to a small audience introduced by M.E. minister Smith.

entries.fullText:
Waveland--Ind.
H.A. Pratt--
Left T. at 8 A.M.--Mrs Jennie
P. Hill the Land Lady-- reached
M. at 10--stopped at M. Smiths
The Drummers House--snowed
& sleeted until night--then
cleared but small audience
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Waveland, Indiana and speaks to a small audience.

entries.fullText:
[stopped at Drummers house] Left M. Smith's--at 6 A.M. [what]
carriage -- missed the train &
waited all day till 2.45 P.M. at
Mr. James Giffords -- [?]
& reached P. at 7.00 P.M.
Stopped at Wm. Ferguson --
Dr. Spottsford introduced me --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from M. Smith's to Perrysville Ind, where she is introduced to Dr. Spottsford.

entries.fullText:
Left P. at 4 P. M.-- Dr. S.
took me to depot -- visited
& talked all day -- decided
never again to stop though the
next day after lecture - too hard work--
-- three store clerks the Com.
here at M.--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony leaves Perrysville Ind and visits Montezuma, Ind where she talks with Dr. S. and three store clerks.

entries.fullText:
Stopped at Hamilton Hotel --
Spoke Opera House --The
cold draft, as usual --
down on neck & shoulders
so I put on shawl & wore
it through speech - took
at 11 P.M. for [?ville]
got letter from [?] &
telegram from [?] here -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at the Opera House in Clinton Ind and receives a letter and telegram.

entries.fullText:
- Train delayed -- didn't
arrive till near 5 A.M.
- rain & sleet & snow
all day long -- ate my
breakfast at near 11 oclock
dinner -- Arlington House
Large audience in the
Opera House at 3.15 P.M.
Spoke on Temp. Dr. Alex. Pollock
Mrs. C. R. Dwight & Dr. A.
Pollock two [?] cannot [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Danville Ill. and speaks at the Opera House on Temp to a large audience.

entries.fullText:
A. W. Tanners
Mr T. is the son of William
L. Tanner - who used to live
near [Plab?] City - above
Battenville Wash. Co. & cousin
of Sophia & Mary Tanner
of Centre Falls -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about meeting A. W. Tanners, the son of William L. Tanner, who used to live near Plab City and is the cousin of Sophia and Mary Tanner of Centre Falls.

entries.fullText:
May W. Thompson
561 north Alabama St -
Arrived at noon - stopped
with Mrs Zenila G. Wallace
Ex. Gov. W's widow - had
small audience - but got
through with speech tolerably
as Mrs W & Mrs S. both said it was
the best argument they had ever heard
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Indianapolis and stays with Mrs. Zenila G. Wallace, the widow of Ex. Gov. W. She gives a speech to a small audience and is told by Mrs. Wallace and Mrs. S. that it was the best argument they had ever heard.

entries.fullText:
Geo. W. Brackenridge
spoke in Berry st. M. E. Church - had
fair audience the M S [society?] [?]
- Was guest of Mrs Caroline
J. Hamilton - widow of Allan
Hamilton - daughter of judge
Holman of Ind - sister of M.C.
Holman of Ind & sister of A.C. Holman
Hamilton now Mrs C. & mother
of Mrs Mary H. Williams who had always
before invited me to Fort Wayne - her
beloved sister Eliza Hamilton
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at Berry St. M. E. Church in Fort Wayne and stays with Mrs. Caroline J. Hamilton, the widow of Allan Hamilton and daughter of Judge Holman of Ind. She is the sister of M.C. Holman of Ind and A.C. Holman Hamilton. Mrs. Hamilton is also the mother of Mrs. Mary H. Williams, who had always invited Susan B. Anthony to Fort Wayne. Mrs. Hamilton's beloved sister is Eliza Hamilton.

entries.fullText:
Rev. J. S. Gledhill
Left Fort Wayne at 11.40 barely
got on board - took sleeper through
to Kent - arrived 9 A.M - Mr
Gledhill is universalist minister here
Mrs R. M. Young - whose sister
Miss Johnson I met at Coast Sagmores
in 1874 called - Had very
good audience
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony leaves Fort Wayne and takes a sleeper to Kent, Ohio. She meets with Rev. J. S. Gledhill, a universalist minister, and Mrs. R. M. Young, whose sister Miss Johnson she met at Coast Sagmores in 1874. She has a very good audience.

entries.fullText:
Wm. Ritegel - Ed.
The Republican Paper here -
Stopped Clifton Hotel
- Had less than a
Hundred people - so hadn't
the heart to take the $20.
- did take 10 - & so made
this expected big night match
with all of the past two weeks
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her stay at the Clifton Hotel in Warren Ohio and her interaction with Wm. Ritegel.

entries.fullText:
Train A.&G. W. train at 9 A.M.
reached Salamanca at 3. couldn't
resist going home so went
on State Line & surprized
them at No. 7 at 9 P.M -
Mother about the same - very
little stronger, physically, perhaps,
but all afloat as to time & locality - [?]
& visiting with those who have been
gone over the river 20 & 40 years -
Lives in sort of Dream land -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about visiting her mother in Salamanca, N.Y. and her mother's state of mind.

entries.fullText:
Sister Mary Louise & self
went to Unitarian Church -
Wm & May Hallowell
called in even'g - It
was a real rest to feel
at home - through I could
manage to sleep but
very little either of the
two nights -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about attending church and receiving visitors at her home in Rochester, NY.

entries.fullText:
Left R. at 6.30
A.M -
Salamanca, N.Y.
E.B. Vreeland
Stopped with Conductor of A.
G. W. R. NY - J.W. Barllet -
- Radical of radicals - had a
large Bible - printed on its back
in large gold letters - 'Holy
Absurdities' - too funny for anything -
Small audience - letter from
Mrs. Sophie L.O. Allen S. Newburg Ohio
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her travels to Salamanca, N.Y. and her stay with E.B. Vreeland. She also mentions a letter she received from Mrs. Sophie L.O. Allen of S. Newburg Ohio.

entries.fullText:
Left Salamanca at 8 A.M. arriving
at F. at 10--found list of Mrs. Stanton's
engagements--she is to be at
Batavia tomorrow night & then {?]
Geneseo & all round--& still very
little hope that we can meet--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Franklinville, NY and learns about Mrs. Stanton's engagements in Batavia and Geneseo.

entries.fullText:
Guest of Mrs Thomas Newton
Bunting--Spent from 11 A.M.
to 3.20 P.M. in Buffalo--dined
at cousin Geo. O. Vail's--31 Irving Pl
Terrible snow & wind
storm at night.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Hamburg, NY and spends time with Mrs. Thomas Newton Bunting and cousin Geo. O. Vail in Buffalo.

entries.fullText:
Spent from 10 to [?] in
Buffalo again & at Cousin Geo.
Vails--reached Nunda
at 6 P.M. stage 2 1/2 miles
stopped at Mrs. Dr. F.Z.M.
Whiteaub--fine audience
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Nunda, NY and visits Buffalo and Cousin Geo. Vail before arriving at Mrs. Dr. F.Z.M. Whiteaub's home.

entries.fullText:
Arrived in Rochester at 1.30
took sleigh to No. 7 found dear
Mother quite bright & glad to see me--
Took dinner --& left on 3 P.M. train
found Cousin Lucius L. Howe at
Depot--fine audience
Spent the 21st at Lucius too
till 2 P.M. then to Susan Biddleson
& took Turkey dinner & then train at 4
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Phelps, NY and visits her mother before leaving for Rochester to meet with Cousin Lucius L. Howe and Susan Biddleson.

entries.fullText:
Guest of Gardner H Northup
whose wife- Marian Perkins- is daughter
Rev. E. Perkins & Eliza Short- the daughter
of Hammond Short and Dorcas Weaver)
The son of mother's Aunt Lucy Shorts’s
They have a delightful house & home
Terrible snow storm-- didn’t arrive
till 8. sharp--The committee not the
least [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is a guest of Gardner H Northup in Wollcott, N.Y. during a snow storm.

entries.fullText:
At- Wolcott-
Snow & blow still
continues- at 3 P.M. gone
Temp. lecture to good audience
in hall--not a minister there--
& the Mr. Hamilton & his reform
Club Com. exacted one half of
the 10cts contribution at door--after
having Jewed me out of one-half of
my fee for last night--too small
for [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony gives a lecture in Wolcott to a good audience, but is unhappy with the behavior of Mr. Hamilton and his reform club committee.

entries.fullText:
Am to be the guest of
D.M. Perine,
Blowing still--though bright & cold
Failed to connect at Oswego--so
Had to reach Fulton at 6 p.m.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony becomes the guest of D.M. Perine in Fulton, N.Y. after failing to connect at Oswego due to blowing snow.

entries.fullText:
went Rochester Depot at 7.15--
Waited till 8--then took sleigh to
Hallowells--spent 2 hours with Mrs
Stanton--then to Depot--dined at Lyrann
Cortland at 2.--Sleigh to Cincinnatus
in 2 hours & 20 minutes--cold
in head very severe--decided
not to try & go back to Syracuse &
Fayetteville to see & hear Mrs. Stanton
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends time with Mrs. Stanton and decides not to go back to Syracuse and Fayetteville.

entries.fullText:
Left C. at 9 A.M. & arrived
Binghamton--at 2.30--found
Cousin Harriet Richardson
Wilkinson at home & received a
cordial welcome from her & her
husband--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Cousin Harriet Richardson Wilkinson in Binghamton.

entries.fullText:
Left Cousin Harriet
Richardsons--W. H. Wilkinson's
at 2.30--found train 2 hours late
arrived Goshen at
10 P.M. slept hotel--
Cold better today--
mainly in my head
Called on Cousin Fanny
Benson--keeping a music store
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Cousin Fanny Benson in Goshen.

entries.fullText:
Warwick--N.Y.
Stewart & Demorest
Mrs. Catherine A. Welling
formerly of Elmira--stopping here
Hall over a livery stable
& such a smell--an
insult to ask anybody to go
into it & inhale for an hour
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Mrs. Catherine A. Welling in Warwick.

entries.fullText:
Took team across the
country from Warwick to
Goshen--then Walkil R.R.
to Kingston--found cousin
Henry [Southern?] & wife gone for
the night--but his son Fred &
daughter Maria Vera--Rita--19
& Elizabeth--6--at home & girl
Mary Dougherty--cold--cold & I
in a perfect shiver all this P.M.
& evening & nearly all the night--
Aconite didn't seem to touch it.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Warwick to Goshen to Kingston, where she finds her cousin's son and daughter at home and suffers from the cold.

entries.fullText:
Cattskill--N.Y.
A.D. Wilbur
Found Ferry Boats leaving regularly
both at Rondout & Cattskill--
so reached here at 12 noon
The day perfectly lovely--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Cattskill and notes the lovely weather.

entries.fullText:
Rhinebeck N.Y.
W.A. Rhynders--
Guest of M.P. Canert--old
friend of N.Y. State Teachers [Conventions?]
20 years ago--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is a guest of M.P. Canert in Rhinebeck, who is an old friend from the New York State Teachers Conventions 20 years ago.

entries.fullText:
Want Lectures --
Indianapolis - Mary Wright Thompson
Sec'y Ind. Equal Suff. Party
Mrs P. H. Watson wrote me to stop in [?] her - Astabula - Ohio

Dr Matilda A. Schultz
277 West 4th Street
Cincinnati - Ohio
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about wanting lectures and receiving communication from Mary Wright Thompson, Mrs P. H. Watson, and Dr Matilda A. Schultz.

entries.fullText:
Miss Eliza T. Wilson of
Menomonie - Wis - contributed
$5. to me to go to printing
W.S. tracts for circulation -
sent it to Mrs Sargent Jan 12. 1878

Must return the picture of
Mrs C. I. H. Nichols - at
Mrs Stanton's - with History before
to her son - A.O. Carpenter -
Uriah - Call
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony receives a contribution from Eliza T. Wilson and must return a picture of Mrs C. I. H. Nichols to her son.

entries.fullText:
Deborah Drury -- wants lecture
Haverhill -- Mass --
Mrs. E.B. Carter -- Astoria, ILL
Mrs. F.P. Chamberlain -- Tiffin - Mo.
entries.summaryText: List of people and places interested in lectures.

entries.fullText:
I lectured [?]
September/77 - 29 times
Oct. 24th to Dec. 31/77 - 47 -
Jan - /78 - 27 -
Feb - .78 - 22 -
March - -

Mrs May E. Butler (Teacher)
Clay Centre - Kansas - wants to
lecture - wrote her an offer to work
for N. C. at per cent -
Miss Hindman Denver - 50 per cent
Mrs Clara D. Colby - Beatrice Neb. - 30 per cent
Mrs P.M. Kelsey - 50 per cent -
Mrs Sophia M. Hosmer
162 East Main St. - Rochester
25 per cent -
entries.summaryText: List of people and places interested in lectures and a summary of past lectures given.

entries.fullText:
MEMORANDA.

CASH ACCOUNT - SUMMARY.

JANUARY, . . Received 791 15 Paid 182 80
FEBRUARY, . . Received 862 50 Paid 203 50
MARCH, . . . Received 425 40 Paid 148 50
APRIL, . . . Received 289 Paid 79 14
MAY, . . .
JUNE, . . .
JULY, . . .
AUGUST, . .
SEPTEMBER, . .
OCTOBER, . .
NOVEMBER, . .
DECEMBER, . .

To Brother J.M. 100.
500.25 490.75

entries.fullText:
Cash Account--January.
Date Received. Paid.
Brot forward 500.25 490.75
21 Calmar 7.50
22 [Le Nay?] 30. 6.80
22 Austin 30.
24 Albert Lea 30. 2.
25 Wells 30. 1.50
26 Blue Earth 30. 4.50
27 ' Cong. Church 18.65
28 Winnebago City 30. 1.
30 St. James 15. 3.75
31 Minneapolis 52.50 6.
Rushes for neck 3.
Sent brother J.M.A. Le[?] 1.50
By Com. on B.B. 25.
Com. to Slayton 106.12
not accounted for 12.38
carried over 31.10
$798.90 798.90

entries.fullText:
Date Received. Paid.
Brot Forward 21.10
1 Litchfield Minn. 30. 9.00
3 Minneapolis ' 25.
4 Hudson Wis. 30. 8.30
5 Red Wing Minn. 30. 3.90
6 Durand Ill. 30. 10.00
7 St Paul Minn 50. 5.15
8 Arcadia Minn 30. 8.55
P.O. Stamps 1.80
11 Baraboo Wis 30. 8.65
' to brother J.M. 150.00
13 Delevan Wis 30. 12.30
14 Darlington Wis 41.75 5.80
15 Mineral Point 30 1.65
16 Lena Ill 14.75 1.55
not accounted for to date 2.55
18 Abbingdon Ill 40. 6.35
19 Prairie C ' 20. .85
20 Palmyra Mo. 25. 1.
